Founder of Functional Capital, invested in Retool, Sentry, Aurora Solar, RudderStack, OpsLevel, and others
Venture Partner at S28 Capital, specializing in SaaS and B2B growth
Research contributions in privacy-oriented and tamper-resistant network tracing (USENIX, HotNets)

conversation_starters: Ask about lessons from scaling PagerDuty from an idea to an IPO-ready business.
Discuss his investment focus on developer-first and product-led SaaS companies.
Explore trends he’s seeing at YC with early-stage technical founders.
Talk about his transition from operator (CTO) to investor and mentor.
notable_projects: PagerDuty — Co-founded incident response SaaS, designed initial alert dispatch system.
Functional Capital — Seed investments in Retool, Sentry, Aurora Solar, RudderStack, and more.
Research publications — Bunker (privacy-oriented network tracing), Tamper Resistant Network Tracing.
YC Group Partner/General Partner — Working directly with new cohorts of founders.

credibility_indicators: General Partner at Y Combinator, globally recognized accelerator
Co-founder of PagerDuty, one of the most successful SaaS IPOs
Portfolio of high-growth SaaS investments (Retool, Sentry, Aurora Solar, etc.)
Strong LinkedIn following and professional presence (1,500+ followers)
Peer endorsements for technical and leadership skills
person_analysis.overview: Andrew Miklas is a General Partner at Y Combinator, a co-founder and former CTO of PagerDuty, and an experienced venture investor. With a background in software engineering and distributed systems, Andrew has transitioned from building highly reliable systems at Amazon and PagerDuty to mentoring and investing in early-stage B2B startups through YC and Functional Capital.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Andrew combines technical depth as a software engineer with proven entrepreneurial success and venture experience. From co-founding PagerDuty and scaling it to IPO to investing in developer-first companies, he now serves as General Partner at Y Combinator, where he shapes the next generation of founders.
key_insights: Deep operator experience scaling PagerDuty into a market leader in incident response SaaS.
Now leverages that background to mentor technical founders and invest in PLG B2B companies.
Academic grounding in software engineering and computer science contributes to technical credibility in venture decisions.
Bridges both technical and financial expertise across startup lifecycles.
